text:
Uneasiness and Decisions

Raskolnikov sits in a tavern, troubled.  
His conscience gnaws at him.  
“Is this where I should be?”  

---  

Raskolnikov rushes out, heart racing.  
“Better the struggle again! Yes!”  
Thoughts of Dounia and his mother panic him.  

---  

Raskolnikov wakes in bushes, fevered.  
“Home… I must go home.”  
He arrives late, feeling calmer.  

---  

Razumihin enters, eyes scanning Raskolnikov.  
“Ah, he’s eating, then he’s not ill.”  
“Something’s wrong… I can feel it.”

**PAGE SUMMARY:** Raskolnikov experiences a mix of unease and relief as he grapples with his conscience and the impending funeral of Katerina Ivanovna.
